intro: Rubus goniophyllus var. goniophylloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blackberry, is a shrub native to parts of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or moist soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
